summary: Extreme heat is the leading weather-related cause of death in the United States. A 2024 study found that the total number of heat-related deaths recorded in the U.S. had more than doubled between 1999 and 2023. title: Extreme Heat: Limited FEMA Assistance Highlights Need for Reevaluation of Agency’s Role
